intro: Canthium venulosum, commonly known as the slender spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, including countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in cup-shaped structures called cyathia. It produces a milky sap that is toxic and can cause skin irritation. Canthium venulosum typically grows in open woodland and grassland habitats, often as a shrub or small tree.
